topic.title: Drake played Fortnite on Twitch !
topic.body:
Did you all see that, Drake played Fortnite on Twitch with other personalities as well?

Replay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M8ZAfykOLxU

topic.title: Adding mutiple users to users.json ?
topic.body: Is it possible to add multiple users to users.json ?

topic.title: PureOS or Debian?
topic.body:
Buying a laptop from Purism will get you PureOS installed by default, I know that they have tweaked the Intel Management System and others things. But, my question is, what happens if I decided to uninstall PureOS to install Debian, will I loose all these patches that they made?
And if not, is there any way to get future patches while being on Debian?

topic.title: Is there any Nextcloud like websites on ZeroNet?
topic.body: I don't even know if it's possible

topic.title: Trading Bitcoin on ZeroNet
topic.body: Is there a crypto currency trading platform on ZeroNet? The closer I know is Bisq a P2P trading app, but it's not integrated with ZeroNet in any way.

1521147486_1F9qtxgSgbkeJX7NT2BARwR8XCn1X.body: Thank you for not using merger zites !

1521327196_17sKEqKEfBUwp5e5dB4irTmqc8A44.body: I get this error each time I try to upload a video "Content signing failed 'sha512'" so it may come from the same issue

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_166_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I got this error not on KopyKate, but on IFS site. You are not alone, check github issue.

Strange that's the opposite on my side, because I can upload to IFS

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_168_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Update: i tried to upload video on KopyKate and also see this error. This error is also on ZeroUp ! It seems to be ZeroNet issue

Indeed, way more serious issue than I expected it to be

> [zx1](#comment_6_18WAgYv5L8raYwvt6KQ9zNqFqn9WU4Uab1): The issue is solved.

Yeah that was pretty fast !

1521392984_19s3iztHV7i3fBN9wyiMhiXECoZvy.body:
I think that there is still some major issues, starting there: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1521327196_17sKEqKEfBUwp5e5dB4irTmqc8A44jUqPS#comment_168_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS

It's not a small technical problem it kills a lot of the features available on Zeronet

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_169_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): That was a temporary issue that was fixed today/yesterday.

Indeed that was fast

1521483743_1J97bEwqapAhZf6vaTevvthB5awi7.body:
> [naisa](#comment_8_1CLQdyjUXGdhWumfS4c7vMA8TkjUhNHQkc): no one gives a shit about bad english. Neither I give.I can't help becuase I've decided avoid Google as much as possible

Same

1521582492_128dbVaHobAMsFW25rUVyFxwdCvvf.body:
> [sstrooper](#comment_13_1PfpsxK9HpYgyPkBtdr7C7UJNfhMwFACue): Nope. Purism can disable Intel ME at hardware level.

OK, didn't know that this was a at the hardware level, makes sense now.
So PureOS is Debian with a modified browser and without blobs I guess, and that's it?

> [sstrooper](#comment_14_1PfpsxK9HpYgyPkBtdr7C7UJNfhMwFACue): PureOS is based on Debian. It was developed to ensure privacy protection. If you uninstall it, you will lose just a preconfigured safe environment. Intel ME will remain disabled.

OK, thank you for your time!

> [sstrooper](#comment_21_1PfpsxK9HpYgyPkBtdr7C7UJNfhMwFACue): You are welcome. Now, help me to seed Starship Troopers on KopyKate.

On my way

> [azz](#comment_2_1C8aYoko2ccsGN96xqjCYvWV6jvMWbi7bF): PureOS has no page in English wikipedia

So?

> [naisa](#comment_13_1CLQdyjUXGdhWumfS4c7vMA8TkjUhNHQkc): PureOs is intalled on Librem laptops made by Purism. Those laptops doesnt have any non-free software installed in OS.

But Debian doesn't have any non-free software installed by default as well, no?

> [azz](#comment_5_1C8aYoko2ccsGN96xqjCYvWV6jvMWbi7bF): Distributors pay insufficient attention to advertising

So?

> [naisa](#comment_17_1CLQdyjUXGdhWumfS4c7vMA8TkjUhNHQkc): My apologies. I forgot to write firmware intalled in Librem is also free.

No worries, thanks for the info!

> [azz](#comment_8_1C8aYoko2ccsGN96xqjCYvWV6jvMWbi7bF): How much > tvax: So? [...]

Ho OK, i get it now

1524903149_173pXRMqj6vLLVMV92FuyxAJWmcD5.body: Since 3 months, found out about it on Mastodon

> [balancer73](#comment_46_1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw): If you run out of space (like me :D), and the forum administration does not increase the limits, you can delete old messages or go to an alternative forum with more limits. For example:  Unlimit Talk. Or clone your own.

Thank you for the link didn;'t know about that one!

1526166631_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: I'm using Solus after my Debian stopped working, and it's still rocking hard

1528009037_1H3f2Q8pxbSVy9MuifHryzGQ9i4mm.body: Or at least an extension or something belong these lines?

> [styromaniac](#comment_63_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): There used to be one for Chrome, but it vanished from the Web Store. There's no sign of it being maintained anymore.

That's a shame, that could have grown Zeronet so much more rapidly

1528148704_1rFttYwcvZTeYwTHDHC5iy5PsfwHh.body: You could try with the docker image, way more convenient to use. Tor can be enabled with an argument and of course it auto-updates.

1586878140_128dbVaHobAMsFW25rUVyFxwdCvvf.body:
> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_475_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): Someone couls start a crypto exchange.if they wished. It would be hard to verify if they are scamming or not though.

I mean if the exchange don't hold any funds and only allow peers to exchange assets it would pretty safe against scamming I suppose.

> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_486_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): How do you confirm the peers are not scamming then?

Bisq uses an escrow and a multisig contract. The contract is not closed until the two peers have successfully validated it by sending each other the crypto. If one on them doesn't validate, the contract is cancelled. Depending on the situation the guy being "scammed" get his funds back + the deposit of the other peer.

> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_489_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): I may use it then. Want to swap some cryptocurrencies. I also saw that this allows cash trades?

"I also saw that this allows cash trades?"

Do you mean Dollars to Bitcoin? If so, yes you can trade Fiat to BTC.
